column6: Sampled structures
Orbital gyri; superior, middle, and inferior frontal gyri; rostral and subcallosal gyri; precentral gyrus; paracentral lobule
Superior and inferior parietal lobules; postcentral gyrus; paracentral lobule; precuneus
Superior, middle, and inferior temporal gyri; fusiform gyrus; transverse gyri; planum temporale and planum polare; temporal pole
Striate and extra-striate cortex from the cuneus and lingual gyrus; occipito-temporal gyrus; lateral occipital gyri
Short and long insular gyri
Anterior, posterior, and retrosplenial regions of the cingulate cortex
Parahippocampal gyrus
CA1-CA4 pyramidal cell layers; dentate gyrus; subiculum
Caudate nucleus; putamen; nucleus accumbens
Globus pallidus
Septal nuclei; cholinergic basal forebrain; bed nucleus of the stria terminalis
Claustrum
Lateral, basolateral, basomedial, central, and cortico-medial amygdalar nuclei; amygdaloid transition zone
Anterior, medial, lateral, posterior, and intralaminar nuclei of the thalamus; lateral and medial geniculate nuclei
Reticular nucleus and zona incerta
Subthalamic nucleus
Habenular nuclei; paraventricular nucleus of the thalamus
Anterior, lateral, posterior, and preoptic hypthalamic areas; paraventricular, supraoptic, ventromedial hypothalamic nuclei; mammillary bodies
Cranial nerve nuclei 3 and 4; substantia nigra; red nucleus; ventral tegmental area; pretectal regions; midbrain raphe nuclei, superior and inferior colliculi
Cortex from the lateral hemispheres, paravermis, and vermis
Deep cerebellar nuclei
Pontine grey
Cranial nerve nuclei 5-7; pontine reticular formation and raphe pontis; locus coeruleus; superior olivary complex; central grey of the pons

Cranial nerve nuclei 8-12; spinal portion of the trigeminal nucleus; raphe nuclei and reticular formation of the medula; arcuate nucleus; inferior olivary complex; cuneate nucleus; gracile nucleus; central glial substance
Corpus callosum and cingulum bundle
